name: Remember Job Quiz / Test | Old Testament / Tanakh | 10 Questions

questions.text: In Job 1:21 Job shows his humbleness.  How does he do this?
questions.correct: He says all he has belongs to the Lord.
options: He says that he is better than everyone.
He says that he can do anything.
He says that the Lord will get His share.
questions.explanation:
He says all he has belongs to the Lord.

	Job 1:21 "And said, Naked came I out of my mother's womb, and naked shall I return thither; the Lord gave, and the Lord hath taken away; blessed be the name of the Lord." Some people believe that Job was only a parable and not an actual historical person. Others believe he did exist, but have not found historical proof yet. (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Job_%28Biblical_figure%29)

False.

	Job 6:24 "Teach me, and I will hold my tongue: and cause me to understand wherein I have erred." This is actually being spoken to Eliphaz.  Although patience is considered a virtue, it is not one of the Cardinal Virtues. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virtue#The_four_virtues

questions.text: In Chapter 9, Job admits he's guilty of doing something - what is it?
questions.explanation:
Justification.

	Job 9:20 "If I justify myself, mine own mouth shall condemn me: if I say, I am perfect, it shall also prove me perverse. When people justify things, they make it so that it is right if they do it, even if it is wrong.

False.

	In chapter 16, Job talks about all his troubles, but he also points out that it could be worse. It seems that Job understands why he's had so many hardships and does not consider God to be evil (that is he does not persecute him).

questions.text: Who does Job say will end up better in the long run?
questions.explanation:
the righteous.

	Job 17:9 "The righteous also shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger." Righteous means free from sin.

questions.text: Who does Job say he is afraid of?
questions.explanation:
God.

	Job 23:15 "Therefore am I troubled at his presence: when I consider, I am afraid of him." Job was a wise man as it says in Psalm 111:10 "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom."

questions.text: What is worth more than rubies?
questions.explanation:
wisdom.

	Job 28:18 "No mention shall be made of coral, or of pearls for the price of wisdom is above rubies." Some people think that wisdom is a result of old age. However, this is not true...grey hair is a result of old age.  Wisdom comes as stated earlier, by fearing God. When one fears God, they listen to him, and the they learn and will start to gain wisdom.

questions.text: Job says we shouldn't rejoice in material things; what should we rejoice in?
questions.explanation:
God.

	Job had a lot and he lost a lot.  However, when he learned not to rely on material things, and to rejoice in them, his life started to get better. When he learned to rejoice in God, he had all he needed.

questions.text: Job does receive patience; is he given back what he lost?
options: No, but he doesn't lose any more
questions.explanation:
Yes, and twice as much.

	Job 42:10 says, "And the Lord turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed for his friends: also the Lord gave Job twice as much as he had before." Job's story shows what can happen when you don't trust in the Lord and what can happen as a result of really trusting in the Lord.

questions.text: What is the last word of Job in the King James Version of the Holy Bible?
questions.explanation:
days.

	Job 42:17 "So Job died, being old and full of days." Job lived a good and full life when he died.
